alert.note: Alert for Emanuel; Montgomery; Toombs; Treutlen; Wheeler (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 12 at 7:57PM EST until January 12 at 8:45PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Toombs County in southeastern Georgia... South central Emanuel County in east central Georgia... Southern Treutlen County in east central Georgia... Eastern Wheeler County in central Georgia... Montgomery County in central Georgia... * Until 845 PM EST. * At 757 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Soperton to near Higgston to near Alston to Spring Hill, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Lyons, Soperton, Mount Vernon, Vidalia, Uvalda, Stillmore, Oak Park, Ailey, Higgston, Santa Claus, Alston, Nunez, Tarrytown, Ohoopee, New Branch, Lothair, Spring Hill, Barnhill, McNatt Falls and South Thompson. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for central, southeastern and east central Georgia. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If you see wind damage...hail or flooding...wait until the storm has passed...and then call the National Weather Service toll free at 1 8 6 6 7 6 3 4 4 6 6 or tweet us your report at NWSATLANTA.
